ai-iti28:1.1_0: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
ai-iti28:2.1_0: “Mendicants, when a mendicant has two qualities they live unhappily in the present life—with distress, anguish, and fever—
ai-iti28:2.2_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they can expect a bad rebirth.
ai-iti28:2.4_0: Not guarding the sense doors and eating too much.
ai-iti28:2.5_0: When a mendicant has these two qualities they live unhappily in the present life—with distress, anguish, and fever—
ai-iti28:2.6_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they can expect to be reborn in a bad place.”
ai-iti28:3.2_0: The body is tranquil and mind.
ai-iti28:5.4_0: such a person lives in suffering.”
ai-iti28:6.1_0: That is what the Buddha has heard.
ai-iti28:6.2_0: First the first part of the body.
